item.title: Fuel Tank Quantity Indication Systems (Flight Deck) – Center Tank Indicator Inop

numlitem.para: Center tank is verified to be empty before each refueling.

note.para: If fuel quantity is entered manually, MANUAL appears following the entry. The TOTALIZER display on PROGRESS page 2 is blanked and fuel quantity from the Fuel Quantity Processor Unit is ignored for the remainder of the flight. The FMC now uses calculated fuel quantity.

placard.para: Placard affected Fuel Quantity Indication "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: To verify the fuel quantity in associated tank, accomplish one of the following procedures as appropriate:

Check the associated tank fuel quantity indicator on the fuel control P28 panel. If it is operative, it may be used as the means of determining the quantity in the tank with the inoperative indicator. If it is not operative, placard it inoperative and notify the fuel crew that the automatic fueling shutoff function may be inoperative.
Determine the associated tank’s fuel quantity utilizing measuring sticks and the Fuel Measuring Stick Manual provided with the aircraft.

note.para: The Fuel Measuring Stick Manual provides instruction for using the measuring stick readings and a set of conversion tables that relate stick readings and aircraft attitude to obtain tank quantity. Ensure that the manual corresponds to the units on the measuring stick and the weight units of the aircraft configuration.
With a fuel tank quantity gage inoperative, the total fuel quantity indication (MEL 28-41-7-1 and 28-41-7-2) will be blank.
